POST.POST_BODY: So I got diagnosed with gestational diabetes. This week I suppose to test four times a day and watch my carbs. After that they will decide whether I need medicine or not. Did anyone else go through this? Apparently one of the risks is to have a large baby... :-(

RESPONSE.RESPONSE_BODY: I got diagnosed about 10 weeks ago.  At first it was very disappointing and I felt like I did something wrong.  But it can happen to anyone with any pregnancy.   I didn't have it with my first one.  I've been able to control it with diet alone and no insulin.  Once I seen the dietician and she gave me a number of carbs I could have in a day, it helped alot.  It takes a lot of will power to control what foods you each but it's mostly about portion control.  It'll get easier once you figure out what foods work best for your body.  My doctor said my baby is measuring fine so theres no concern for a big baby.  And once your baby is born there's a good chance it'll go away.  Good luck!
My mom had gestational diabetes with my sister and myself. My sister was an 8lb baby born two weeks late and I was a 5lb baby. So it doesn't necessarily mean your baby will be big.

Yea I had to poke my fingers four times a day for a week an then my levels I guess was good then they ruled it out.. but they still told me to watch my diet... Just watch yours an you will be ok.. they have websites on different foods that diabetics eat.. which can be good.. but if anything pertaining starch just eat smaller portions...
